reviews.text: On the second floor is the restaurant and Business centre. The restaurant serves a breakfast buffet consisting of cereals, cooked English style plus noodles and continental. reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here for four nights on a stopover returning from Australia. We chose it because it was pretty cheap for Hong Kong, but had gotten good reviews on here. Overall it was a good choice. The rooms are nicely appointed. (True, they are small, but that's the norm for Hong Kong. If you want big and spacious, you'd better get a suite somewhere!) Location is fine. You are just on the edge of Causeway Bay. So close enough to enjoy the hustle and bustle, but far enough away to escape it too. Tin Hau underground station is a two minute walk form the hotel, so you can get anywhere in the city very quickly. One of the hotels best features is the roof top pool on the 32nd floor. If you are lucky and get clear weather the views are amazing. The worst feature is possiby the view (or lack of it) if you have a room on the back of the hotel. Had we realised that we would be staring straight into someones apartment opposite, we would have paid the extra money for a room at the front with some sort of view. Due to this we felt the need to keep our curtains closed most of the time we were in the room. We did not use the hotel restaurant, for two reasons. Firstly it's billed as Franco-Japanese fusion. That combination did nothing for my appetite! Plus they have live entertainment, in the form of some local crooner. Every evening on our return from the days exploits we'd hear them whilst we waited for the lift in the lobby. This little taster of what was on offer did not tempt us to go down for a bigger helping! I guess overall, I would say this was a good place to lay your head for the night, and catch a few rays on the roof. Beyond that, this is not a hotel to hang around in and enjoy.
reviews.title: Cheap treat

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel itself is a pretty standard business hotel. I think it worked out about £110 a night which for Hong Kong I feel is average for a hotel of this standard. We had a room which was spotlessly clean but as you would expect a bit small overlooking Victoria Park on the 15th floor (see photo) and although not as spectacular as looking over from Kowloon it was a pretty nice view. The roof top pool on the 30th floor has fantastic views although not much good for people with vertigo. Overall pretty good.

reviews.title: Excellent Hotel
reviews.text: PRO: convenient location to get to and from the shopping district (although Causeway Bay is a major shopping district), Ferry ports, and metro stations. Within walking distance to eateries nearby. There's a great bakery around the corner that has vegetarian pastries! Victoria Park is right across the street as is the Noon Day Gun. Great view of the HK Harbor and stunning sights at night of Victoria Peak and the Star Ferries crossing in the evenings. Quiet rooms although they are "Japanese-style" (i.e., small) yet cozy and relaxing. Hotel offered free drink tickets upon our arrival.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: CON: small rooms if you require tons of space. A bit difficult to find at first, but look up for the hotel sign right out of the Tin Hau station. A bit further from the central terminal than other hotels if you plan to head to outer islands such as Lamma Island or take a Star Ferry ride. But if you like to walk and have purchased an octopus card, then this hotel is a good location to start from.

description: Metropark Hotel Causeway Bay Hong Kong, a business and leisure hotel with unrivalled harbour view, full range of facilities & services and convenient location, just 2 minutes walk to underground station and 10 minutes to Hong Kong Convention and Exhibition Centre by Hotel FREE Shuttle, welcoming you to experience a contemporary retreat featuring comfort guestrooms and relaxing ambience. Innovative dining concept and well-equipped facilities are complemented by great service and stunning views of Hong Kong’s harbour. All round facilities include 24-hour FREE Broadband Internet Access, Rooftop Outdoor Swimming Pool, Health Club, Sauna, Jacuzzi, Business Centre, Restaurant & Pub and more…
